data.title: Census & Vital Records
data.text:
Marriage and Divorce Records

Birth and Death Records

Adoption Records

Federal Census Records

The Indiana State Archives does not have copies of the regular Federal Census, however microfilm copies are held by the Genealogy Division of the Indiana State Library. Indexes are available for most years; contact the Genealogy Division for further information.

The publicly available years of the U.S. census are available on several commercial genealogy sites. FamilySearch provides access free of charge, although you must create an account and sign in: https://www.familysearch.org/

Special Census

The State Archives does have Special Census schedules available on microfilm in the reading room. These include:

The Agricultural Census 1850-1880 (Available on FamilySearch)

The Manufacturers Census 1820-1880

Social Statistics 1850-1880

Census of Defective, Dependent, and Delinquent (3-D Census) 1880

State Census

Indiana's state censuses were performed solely as a legislative count of the population performed by count officials. They only delivered statistical information to the state government. Thus, no similar state record to the federal census, with its full names and locations, exists.
